title: The FDA has authorized Covid-19 vaccines for children under 5. What should parents know?
summary:
(CNN) The US Food and Drug Administration gave emergency use authorization on Friday for both the Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna vaccines for young children.
When will vaccines be available to young kids, and how will families access them?
It's been a year and a half since adults first started getting the Covid-19 vaccine.
Parents are used to getting kids vaccinated there, and the pediatrician will know when and if they plan on giving the Covid-19 vaccine.
You could also contact your local pharmacies, though note that many pharmacies may not be equipped to provide shots to young kids.
